question.title: Why is my Eclipse RCP PropertyTester not being invoked for enabling a command?
question.body:
Title:

"Why is my Eclipse RCP PropertyTester not being invoked for enabling a command?"

Summary:

I am working on an Eclipse RCP application where I have defined a command with a handler and want to conditionally enable or disable it using a PropertyTester. Here's what I have done:

  1. Handler and Command Configuration: I defined the command and handler in plugin.xml, using the enabledWhen clause to reference a property:

    <handler
    class="com.example.simulation.handlers.MyHandler"
    commandId="com.example.simulation.commands.myCommand">
    <enabledWhen>
        <test
            property="com.example.simulation.licenseTester.isValidLicense"
            value="true">
        </test>
    </enabledWhen>
</handler>

  2. PropertyTester Definition: I created a PropertyTester and registered it in plugin.xml:

    <propertyTester
    class="com.example.simulation.util.LicenseTester"
    id="com.example.simulation.licensePropertyTester"
    namespace="com.example.simulation.licenseTester"
    properties="isValidLicense"
    type="java.lang.Object">
</propertyTester>

  3. PropertyTester Implementation: The test method checks a license condition:

    public class LicenseTester extends PropertyTester {
    @Override
    public boolean test(Object receiver, String property, Object[] args, Object expectedValue) {
        if ("isValidLicense".equals(property)) {
            return LicenseManager.getInstance().checkLicense();
        }
        return false;
    }
}

Despite this setup, the test method of my PropertyTester is not being invoked when the application runs. I have verified that the logic in LicenseManager.getInstance().checkLicense() is correct.

Troubleshooting Steps Taken:

  • Verified that the plugin.xml configurations are correct.
  • Added debug logs inside the test method, but it is not being hit.
  • Checked for errors in the Eclipse Error Log but found none.
  • Cleaned and rebuilt the project, restarted Eclipse with the -clean option.

What might I be missing? How can I ensure that the PropertyTester is invoked?

Any help or suggestions would be greatly appreciated!
